title: @RIOT UNDERCOVER  ( TOO OP )
body:
If you have played with riot employees you will see there in 99% no chance of toxicity or BM in that game.. so why not riot employees go undercover where they can look up player behavior. I don't know what is the level of toxicity for punishment but they can find a lot of players who needs to be punished if they don't use their riot profiles. I stand up to toxicity and BM and get reported myself for no reason. Many think getting involved into this will get them reported so they stay out of it. Under cover riot guys can reward those who are good examples of summoners and monitor the behavior of toxic players before punishing them. 

Rough idea still a lot to be thought on.

Thanks for reading this .
Comment on what you think can be done more or even if you disagree with this.

As a Rioter, you can opt to have 'Riot' in front of your name, or you can keep your regular summoner name. For example, I used to just be KateyKhaos prior to working at Riot. When I started, I opted to have 'Riot' added to the front of my IGN.

I can't speak on behalf of the new behavior system, it's not something I'm personally working on. However, if I opted not to put 'Riot in my name, I wouldn't be collecting data - just playing the game.

I'm having a hard time asking specifically what i want to ask for some reason.

Ultimately, we're players like everyone else. We're not there to be police - we're there to play and (hopefully) win. :P If someone is being a jerk, we (everyone, too, not just Rioters) can call them out and ask them to stop. If someone is being toxic, we can use the report feature at the end of game.
